alert.note: Alert for Blue Mountains of Washington; Southeast Washington Grande Ronde Valley (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 21 at 10:40PM PDT until August 22 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...ISOLATED TO SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS EXPECTED ACROSS EASTERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA OVERNIGHT THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... .A disturbance crossing the area overnight is expected to result in isolated thunderstorms becoming scattered in the eastern mountain zones during the day on Monday. Abundant lightning is expected over the Blue Mountains and Wallowa County. Other portions of the area can expect isolated thunderstorms. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM PDT MONDAY FOR ABUNDANT LIGHTNING FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES OR643, OR644, OR645, WA692, AND WA693... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zones 643 Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon, 644 Central Blue Mountains, 645 Wallowa District, 692 Blue Mountains of Washington and 693 Southeast Washington Grande Ronde Valley. * IMPACTS...Lightning strikes may create new fire starts. * THUNDERSTORMS...Storms will be possible overnight from the Ochoco-John Day Highlands northward into the Blue Mountains and Wallowa County. Storms are expected to become scattered by tomorrow morning. Individual cells may have wetting rains but most are expected to have just a few hundredths of an inch. Additionally, lightning may strike in dry areas away from the rainfall within these storms. * OUTFLOW WINDS...Erratic winds up to 40 mph will be possible with these storms.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Blue Mountains of Washington; Southeast Washington Grande Ronde Valley
